greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest b such that b^((p-1)/2) == -1 (mod p) where p = A080076(n) is the n-th Proth prime.
comment: Proth's theorem asserts that p=1+k*2^m (with odd k < 2^m) is prime if there exists b such that b^((p-1)/2) == -1 (mod n). This sequence lists the smallest b which certifies primality of A080076(n) via this relation.
For n > 3, a(n) is an odd prime. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Apr 23 2019
formula: a(n) = A020649(A080076(n)) = A053760(k), where prime(k) = A080076(n). - _Thomas Ordowski_, Apr 23 2019
xref: A subsequence of A020649 and of A053760.
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 18 2014
